trans-unit.source: Walkthrough-- Implement shadow volumes using depth buffers in Direct3D 11
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough-- Implement shadow volumes using depth buffers in Direct3D 11

trans-unit.source: This walkthrough demonstrates how to render shadow volumes using depth maps, using Direct3D 11 on devices of all Direct3D feature levels.
trans-unit.target: This walkthrough demonstrates how to render shadow volumes using depth maps, using Direct3D 11 on devices of all Direct3D feature levels.

trans-unit.source: Walkthrough: Implement shadow volumes using depth buffers in Direct3D 11
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough: Implement shadow volumes using depth buffers in Direct3D 11

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: This walkthrough demonstrates how to render shadow volumes using depth maps, using Direct3D 11 on devices of all Direct3D feature levels.
trans-unit.target: This walkthrough demonstrates how to render shadow volumes using depth maps, using Direct3D 11 on devices of all Direct3D feature levels.

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Create depth buffer device resources
trans-unit.target: Create depth buffer device resources

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create the Direct3D device resources necessary to support depth testing for shadow volumes.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create the Direct3D device resources necessary to support depth testing for shadow volumes.

trans-unit.source: Render the shadow map to the depth buffer
trans-unit.target: Render the shadow map to the depth buffer

trans-unit.source: Render from the point of view of the light to create a two-dimensional depth map representing the shadow volume.
trans-unit.target: Render from the point of view of the light to create a two-dimensional depth map representing the shadow volume.

trans-unit.source: Render the scene with depth testing
trans-unit.target: Render the scene with depth testing

trans-unit.source: Create a shadow effect by adding depth testing to your vertex (or geometry) shader and your pixel shader.
trans-unit.target: Create a shadow effect by adding depth testing to your vertex (or geometry) shader and your pixel shader.

trans-unit.source: Support shadow maps on a range of hardware
trans-unit.target: Support shadow maps on a range of hardware

trans-unit.source: Render higher-fidelity shadows on faster devices and faster shadows on less powerful devices.
trans-unit.target: Render higher-fidelity shadows on faster devices and faster shadows on less powerful devices.

trans-unit.source: Shadow mapping application to Direct3D 9 desktop porting
trans-unit.target: Shadow mapping application to Direct3D 9 desktop porting

trans-unit.source: Windows 8 adde d depth comparison functionality to feature level 9\_1 and 9\_3.
trans-unit.target: Windows 8 adde d depth comparison functionality to feature level 9\_1 and 9\_3.

trans-unit.source: Now you can migrate rendering code with shadow volumes to DirectX 11, and the Direct3D 11 renderer will be downlevel compatible with feature level 9 devices.
trans-unit.target: Now you can migrate rendering code with shadow volumes to DirectX 11, and the Direct3D 11 renderer will be downlevel compatible with feature level 9 devices.

trans-unit.source: This walkthrough shows how any Direct3D 11 app or game can implement traditional shadow volumes using depth testing.
trans-unit.target: This walkthrough shows how any Direct3D 11 app or game can implement traditional shadow volumes using depth testing.

trans-unit.source: The code covers the following process:
trans-unit.target: The code covers the following process:

trans-unit.source: Creating Direct3D device resources for shadow mapping.
trans-unit.target: Creating Direct3D device resources for shadow mapping.

trans-unit.source: Adding a rendering pass to create the depth map.
trans-unit.target: Adding a rendering pass to create the depth map.

trans-unit.source: Adding depth testing to the main rendering pass.
trans-unit.target: Adding depth testing to the main rendering pass.

trans-unit.source: Implementing the necessary shader code.
trans-unit.target: Implementing the necessary shader code.

trans-unit.source: Options for fast rendering on downlevel hardware.
trans-unit.target: Options for fast rendering on downlevel hardware.

trans-unit.source: Upon completing this walkthrough, you should be familiar with how to implement a basic compatible shadow volume technique in Direct3D 11 that's compatible with feature level 9\_1 and above.
trans-unit.target: Upon completing this walkthrough, you should be familiar with how to implement a basic compatible shadow volume technique in Direct3D 11 that's compatible with feature level 9\_1 and above.

trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.target: You should [Prepare your dev environment for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX game development](prepare-your-dev-environment-for-windows-store-directx-game-development.md).

trans-unit.source: You don't need a template yet, but you'll need Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 to build the code sample for this walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: You don't need a template yet, but you'll need Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 to build the code sample for this walkthrough.
